Graficar VO−VIV_O - V_IVO​−VI​ de VI=−10VV_I=-10VVI​=−10V hasta VI=10VV_I=10VVI​=10V. Después asuma que VI=10sin⁡(wt)VV_I=10\sin{(wt)}VVI​=10sin(wt)V. Grafique VO−tV_O - tVO​−t. V_I<0.6V  ⟹  V_O=0V_I>0.6V  ⟹  V_O=(I_D)(R)=(V_I−V_γR+r_f)(R)V_O=V_I−0.61000+20(1000)V_O(10)=10−0.61000+20(1000)=9.2157V\begin{gathered} V\_I < 0.6V \implies V\_O = 0\\ V\_I > 0.6V \implies V\_O = (I\_D)(R) = (\frac{V\_I-V\_\gamma}{R + r\_f})(R)\\ V\_O = \frac{V\_I-0.6}{1000+20}(1000)\\ V\_O(10)=\frac{10-0.6}{1000+20}(1000) = 9.2157V \end{gathered}V_I<0.6V⟹V_O=0V_I>0.6V⟹V_O=(I_D)(R)=(R+r_fV_I−V_γ​)(R)V_O=1000+20V_I−0.6​(1000)V_O(10)=1000+2010−0.6​(1000)=9.2157V​
V_O=(I_D)(R)=(V_I−V_γR+r_f)(R)V_O=((10sin⁡(wt))−0.61000+20)(1000)=010sin⁡(wt)−0.6=0  ⟹  sin⁡(wt_1)=0.610=0.06x_1=(wt_1)=sin⁡−1(0.06)=3.439°=0.060036radx_2=(wt_2)=180°−3.439°=176.560°=3.081556radVO(avg)=1T∫T_0VO(t)dt=12π∫2π_0(10sin⁡(x)−0.6)dxVO(avg)=12π(((−10cos⁡176.560°)−(−10cos⁡3.439°))+((−0.6(3.081556))−(−0.6(0.060036))))VO(avg)=2.888V\begin{gathered} V\_O = (I\_D)(R) = (\frac{V\_I-V\_\gamma}{R + r\_f})(R)\\ V\_O = (\frac{(10\sin{(wt)})-0.6}{1000 + 20})(1000) = 0\\ 10\sin{(wt)}-0.6 = 0 \implies \sin{(wt\_1)} = \frac{0.6}{10} = 0.06\\ x\_1 = (wt\_1) = \sin^{-1}{(0.06)} = 3.439° = 0.060036 rad\\ x\_2 = (wt\_2) = 180° - 3.439° = 176.560° = 3.081556 rad\\ V_{O(avg)} = \frac{1}{T} \int^{T}\_{0} V_O(t) dt = \frac{1}{2\pi} \int^{2\pi}\_{0} (10\sin{(x)}-0.6) dx\\ V_{O(avg)} = \frac{1}{2\pi}(( (-10\cos{176.560°}) - (-10\cos{3.439°}) ) + ((-0.6(3.081556))-(-0.6(0.060036))))\\ V_{O(avg)} = 2.888V\\ \end{gathered}V_O=(I_D)(R)=(R+r_fV_I−V_γ​)(R)V_O=(1000+20(10sin(wt))−0.6​)(1000)=010sin(wt)−0.6=0⟹sin(wt_1)=100.6​=0.06x_1=(wt_1)=sin−1(0.06)=3.439°=0.060036radx_2=(wt_2)=180°−3.439°=176.560°=3.081556radVO(avg)​=T1​∫T_0VO​(t)dt=2π1​∫2π_0(10sin(x)−0.6)dxVO(avg)​=2π1​(((−10cos176.560°)−(−10cos3.439°))+((−0.6(3.081556))−(−0.6(0.060036))))VO(avg)​=2.888V​
π2rad=90°V_O(max)=((10sin⁡(90°))−0.61000+20)(1000)=9.2157V\begin{gathered} \frac{\pi}{2} rad = 90°\\ V\_{O(max)} = (\frac{(10\sin{(90°)})-0.6}{1000 + 20})(1000) = 9.2157V \end{gathered}2π​rad=90°V_O(max)=(1000+20(10sin(90°))−0.6​)(1000)=9.2157V​

2.2 Demostrar que si el voltaje de entrada es mayor o igual a 0 para el circuito anterior entonces el voltaje de salida es aproximadamente VO=VI−VTln(VOISR)V_O=V_I-V_Tln(\frac{V_O}{I_SR})VO​=VI​−VT​ln(IS​RVO​​).

LKVV_O=V_R=V_I−V_DDiodo IdealV_D=(V_T)(ln(i_DI_S)∴VO≈V_I−V_Tln(V_OI_SR)\begin{gathered} \text{LKV}\\ V\_O = V\_R = V\_I - V\_D\\ \text{Diodo Ideal}\\ V\_D = (V\_T)(ln\left(\frac{i\_D}{I\_S}\right)\\ \therefore V_O \approx V\_I-V\_T ln(\frac{V\_O}{I\_SR}) \end{gathered}LKVV_O=V_R=V_I−V_DDiodo IdealV_D=(V_T)(ln(I_Si_D​)∴VO​≈V_I−V_Tln(I_SRV_O​)​

En este problema recordamos la ecuación para el voltaje del diodo ideal ignorando el menos uno a que solo estamos considerando el voltaje positivo.
